Package embedding.measures

Interface Measure<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of objects that may be compared by this measure
All Known Subinterfaces:
DirectMeasure<T>, InterruptionMeasure<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AnyDiscreteFrechet, ApproxFrechet, DiscreteFrechet, IntegralDiscreteFrechet
public interface Measure<T>
A Measure imposes a distance function on some collection of objects. Measures can be used to define the dissimilarity of specific objects.

The distance imposed by a Measure δ on a set of elements S is said to be consistent with the following rules for all a, b ∈ S:

  • δ(a,a) = 0
  • δ(a,b) ≥ 0
  • δ(a,b) = δ(b,a)

In case the exact distance of two objects is does only matter if it is less or equal a previously known threshold, the measurement can also be capped at a maximum value. In many cases this allows for more efficient calculations.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    double distance​(T a, T b)
    Calculates the distance of the given objects.
    double distanceCapped​(T a, T b, double max)
    Calculates the distance of the given objects if small enough.

  • Method Details

    • distance

      double distance​(T a, T b)
      Calculates the distance of the given objects.
      Parameters:
      a - the first object
      b - the second object
      Returns:
      their distance

    • distanceCapped

      double distanceCapped​(T a, T b, double max)
      Calculates the distance of the given objects if small enough.
      Parameters:
      a - the first object
      b - the second object
      max - the maximum distance of interest
      Returns:
      their distance, or Double.POSITIVE_INDIFINITY in case their distance is larger than the given maximum
